article: When I was growing up, my father always stopped what he was doing and listened while I'd breathlessly fill him in on my day. _ the time I graduated from college, I got a job teaching special education at a school about 170 miles from home. " Be careful ," Dad warned me during my visit home. He was _ about my living alone. One evening, I stayed after _ to rearrange my classroom. Finished, I realized the gate was _ ! Everyone else had gone home. After checking all the _ , I found just enough room to squeeze under the gate. I lay on my back and _ edged through. Suddenly, I saw about several boys following me. Quickening my _ , I reached into my shoulder bag to get my key ring. But the key ring wasn't there! "Hey! Let's _ the lady!" one boy shouted. Suddenly, my fingers wrapped around a _ key in my purse. I did not even _ if it was for my car. I reached my car and the key _ ! I opened the door, slid in and locked it -- just as the teenagers surrounded the car. _ , I started the engine and drove away. Some teachers went back to the school with me _ . With flashlights, we found the key ring on the ground by the gate, _ it had fallen as I slid through. When I returned to my apartment, the phone was ringing. It was _ . "Oh, I forgot to tell you. I put a (an) _ car key into your purse" he said. "in _ you ever need it." Today, I keep that key in my drawer and _ it. Whenever I hold it in my hand, I am _ of all the wonderful things Dad has done for me over the years.
